headline.main: New York Attorney General Seeks Expanded Reports on Data Breaches
headline.print_headline: New York Attorney General Seeks Expanded Reports on Data Breaches

docs.abstract: A planned bill would expand New York’s definition of what constitutes the type of private information whose breach would mandate a disclosure. It would cover email addresses and passwords.
docs.snippet: A planned bill would expand New York’s definition of what constitutes the type of private information whose breach would mandate a disclosure. It would cover email addresses and passwords.

docs.lead_paragraph: With a month to go in the 2015 open enrollment season, the Obama administration says sign-ups under the president's health care law are edging higher.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators have approved an appetite-suppressing implant designed to treat obesity by zapping nerves that connect the stomach and the brain.

headline.main: FDA Approves Appetite-Zapping Implant for Obese Patients
headline.print_headline: FDA Approves Appetite-Zapping Implant for Obese Patients

docs.lead_paragraph: Filing a federal tax return is about to get more complicated for millions of families because of President Barack Obama's health law. But they shouldn't expect much help from the Internal Revenue Service.

headline.main: Need Help Filing Out Your Tax Return? Don't Call the IRS
headline.print_headline: Need Help Filing Out Your Tax Return? Don't Call the IRS

docs.snippet: Filing a federal tax return is about to get more complicated for millions of families because of President Barack Obama's health law. But they shouldn't expect much help from the Internal Revenue Service.

docs.lead_paragraph: The continuing assault on the 2010 Dodd-Frank law has achieved remarkable success, especially compared with the repeated failures of opponents of another 2010 law, the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: In New Congress, Wall St. Pushes to Undermine Dodd-Frank Reform
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Chips Away at Dodd-Frank Rules

docs.abstract: America's largest banks and investment firms have twice gained passage of bills in past month to loosen regulations meant to help reduce risk of another financial crisis, aiming at arcane provisions and employing flurries of lobbying; House approves measure to further defang 2010 Dodd-Frank law by placing more limits on regulators.
docs.snippet: The continuing assault on the 2010 Dodd-Frank law has achieved remarkable success, especially compared with the repeated failures of opponents of another 2010 law, the Affordable Care Act.

docs.abstract: The institution may be at a historic low in size, but a new study suggests that membership has psychological benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's signature health care law will bring a new twist to tax-filing in 2015, a year in which much else will seem familiar when you're working on your return.
